com.mygdx.game

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mygdx.game.Level

  • public class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    The level class contains the map used by the game and stores all characters.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Character> characters
      The list of all world characters (including the player).
      private com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMapTileLayer collisionLayer
      The collision layer on the world map.
      com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2[] doors
      The doors for entering for advancing map segment.
      com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2[] exits
      Where each of the doors in the doors array teleports the player to.
      com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMap map
      The world map.
      com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 mapBounds
      The size of the map in pixels.
      Player player
      The player.
      boolean stopInput
      Whether input is blocked.
      static int TILE_SIZE
      The size of one tile in the level map.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Level()
      Creates a new Level by loading the map and setting up the player.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(float delta)
        Updates the state of this Level by updating each of its characters.
        Parameters:
        delta - the time elapsed since the last update

      • checkWater

        public boolean checkWater(int x,
                          int y)
        Checks whether a tile is water.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the tile
        y - the y coordinate of the tile
        Returns:
        true if the specified tile is water, false if not

      • checkCollision

        public boolean checkCollision(int x,
                              int y)
        Checks whether the specified tile is impassable due to it being blocked or occupied.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the tile
        y - the y coordinate of the tile
        Returns:
        true if the specified tile is blocked or occupied.

      • isTileOccupied

                               int y)
        Checks whether the specified tile is occupied by a character.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the tile
        y - the y coordinate of the tile
        Returns:

      • getCharacterAt

        public Character getCharacterAt(float tileX,
                                float tileY)
        Gets the character at the specified tile.
        Parameters:
        tileX - the x coordinate of the tile
        tileY - the y coordinate of the tile
        Returns:
        the character at the specified tile or null if there is no character there
